text: Derby Corporation Tramways was the tram system serving the city of Derby (then a town), England. It opened on 27 July 1904. ==History== Map of the Derby Corporation Tramways Derby Corporation tram waiting outside Derby railway station The company was formed by the corporation which took over the assets of the Derby Tramways Company, which had provided horse-drawn tramway services since 1880. It was closed nearly 30 years later, on 29 June 1934. The four foot gauge tramways were replaced by Derby trolleybuses. The conversion began in 1932. ==Preserved trams== Tramcar n°1 is the only Derby tramcar preserved and is located at the National Tramway Museum in Crich, Derbyshire. This tram was used for crew training prior to the opening of the system. ==References== Category:Tram transport in England Category:Transport in Derby Category:4 ft gauge railways in England
